body.p: Born on March 8, 1799 in Maytown, Pennsylvania. Orphaned at nine years old before becoming an apprentice printer under Andrew Kennedy. In 1821, Cameron was the editor of the Bucks County Messenger. Editor of the Republican in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania in 1824. Was the Pennsylvania state printer from 1825 - 1827. Served as the adjutant general of Pennsylvania in 1826. Cameron was a United States Senator from Pennsylvania from 1845 - 1849. Secretary of War under Abraham Lincoln March 5, 1861 to January 14, 1862. He was forced to resign due to corruption allegations. Died in Maytown, Pennsylvania on June 26, 1889.

bibl.p: Paul Kahan, * Amiable Scoundrel: Simon Cameron, Lincoln's Scandalous Secretary of War* (Washington D.C.: Potomac Books, 2016).
